alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 03 at 6:09AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: .Areas of heavy rainfall expected through this evening across Wallowa County, with previous years` burn scars vulnerable to localized flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Wallowa County. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars from last year`s wildfires are particularly vulnerable to flash flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are forecast over the higher terrain of eastern Wallowa County, with localized amounts of 1.5 inches in heavier showers and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
